fields.description:
After mounting HDFS filesystem using NFS gateway, we are not able to see .snapshot folder. We get the below error message while accessing the snapshot folder. 
ls: cannot access /xxxx/.snapshot: Input/output error .
The error message seen in the nfs gateway log:-
WARN nfs3.RpcProgramNfs3 (RpcProgramNfs3.java:getattr(344)) - Exception 
org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException(java.io.FileNotFoundException): File for given inode path does not exist: /.reserved/.inodes/-1
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSDirectory.resolveDotInodesPath(FSDirectory.java:1642)
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSDirectory.resolvePath(FSDirectory.java:1610)
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSDirectory.resolvePath(FSDirectory.java:640)
at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSDirStatAndListingOp.getFileInfo(FSDirStatAndListingOp.java:104)

fields.summary: Not able to access the snapshot folder using NFS gateway
